data.name: Sample - Fortinet FortiEDR - 1.3.0
data.description: Sample playbooks for "Fortinet FortiEDR" connector. If you are planning to use any of the sample playbooks in your environment, ensure that you clone those playbooks and move them to a different collection, since the sample playbook collection gets deleted during connector upgrade and delete.

workflows.name: Update Events
workflows.description:
Updates events in Fortinet FortiEDR that match the condition(s) you have specified. 
Note: If none of the input parameters that you specify match the events in Fortinet FortiEDR, then an empty result set is returned.

workflows.name: Get Event List Extended
workflows.description: Retrieves archived/unarchived events together from Fortinet FortiEDR that match the condition(s) you have specified. Note: If none of the input parameters that you specify match the events in Fortinet FortiEDR, then an empty result set is returned.

arguments.title: Fortinet FortiEDR: Get Event List Extended

workflows.name: Unisolate Collector
workflows.description: Unisolates a collector from the Fortinet FortiEDR network based on the device ID and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Get File
workflows.description: Retrieves a specific file from the specified device from Fortinet FortiEDR, based on the device type, device name/ID, and file paths you have specified, and adds it as an attachment in CyOPsâ„¢

workflows.name: Update Exception
workflows.description: Update the exception based on the given input.

workflows.name: Remediate Device
workflows.description: Takes remediation actions on Fortinet FortiEDR such as killing a process, deleting a file and/or cleaning persistent data on which malware was detected based on the device type, device name/ID, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Get Events
workflows.description: Retrieves all the events from Fortinet FortiEDR that match the condition(s) you have specified. Note: If none of the input parameters that you specify match the events in Fortinet FortiEDR, then an empty result set is returned.

workflows.name: Get Raw Data Items
workflows.description: Retrieves the raw data items from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the event ID and other input parameters you have specified.

arguments.title: Fortinet FortiEDR: Get Raw Data Items

workflows.name: Delete IPSet
workflows.description: Delete the IP set using the IP Set names.

workflows.name: Get Agent Groups
workflows.description: Get agent group list from the FortiEDR

workflows.name: Isolate Collector
workflows.description: Isolates a collector from the Fortinet FortiEDR network based on the device ID and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Create Exception
workflows.description: Creates a new exception in Fortinet FortiEDR based on the specified input parameters.

workflows.name: Get Event Count
workflows.description: Retrieves the event count from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the filter parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: > FortiEDR > Fetch Events
workflows.description: Fetch events from FortiEDR based on the filter parameters.

step_variables._configuration_schema:
[
  {
    "title": "Pull Events Created In Last X Minutes",
    "name": "fetch_last_minutes",
    "type": "text",
    "tooltip": "Fetch incidents from last X minutes. e.g 5",
    "required": true,
    "editable": true,
    "visible": true,
    "value": ""
  },
  {
    "title": "Time Zone",
    "name": "time_zone",
    "type": "text",
    "tooltip": "Please specify the time zone. eg: UTC, Asia/Kolkata",
    "required": true,
    "editable": true,
    "visible": true
  },
  {
    "title": "Event IDs",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "text",
    "name": "eventIds",
    "tooltip": "The list of event IDs separated by comma.",
    "placeholder": "e.g. 112903,112848",
    "description": "List of event IDs based on which you want to retrieve events from Fortinet FortiEDR."
  },
  {
    "title": "Device Name",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "text",
    "name": "device",
    "value": "",
    "tooltip": "The device name where the events occurred.",
    "placeholder": "e.g test-device",
    "description": "Name of the device on which the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred."
  },
  {
    "title": "Collector Groups",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "text",
    "name": "collectorGroups",
    "value": "",
    "placeholder": "e.g. Test Collector Group1,Test Collector Group2",
    "tooltip": "The list of collector groups whose collector reported the events.",
    "description": "List of collector groups whose collector had reported the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR."
  },
  {
    "title": "Operating System",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "text",
    "name": "operatingSystems",
    "value": "",
    "placeholder": "e.g.Windows 7 Pro",
    "description": "Name of the operating system of the devices on which the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred."
  },
  {
    "title": "Device IPs",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "text",
    "name": "deviceIps",
    "value": "",
    "tooltip": "The IPs of the devices where the event occurred.",
    "placeholder": "e.g. 192.168.50.10,192.168.50.50",
    "description": "List of IP addresses of the devices on which the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred."
  },
  {
    "title": "MAC Addresses",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "text",
    "name": "macAddresses",
    "value": "",
    "tooltip": "The MAC addresses where the event occurred.",
    "placeholder": "e.g. 00-0C-29-D0-0A-4F",
    "description": "MAC addresses where the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR occurred."
  },
  {
    "title": "Classification",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "multiselect",
    "name": "classifications",
    "options": [
      "Malicious",
      "Suspicious",
      "Inconclusive",
      "PUP",
      "Likely Safe",
      "Safe"
    ],
    "value": "",
    "description": "Classification of the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. Classification is a list of strings that contain one or more of the following values: Malicious, Suspicious, Inconclusive, Likely Safe, PUP, or Safe."
  },
  {
    "title": "Actions",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "select",
    "options": [
      "Block",
      "SimulationBlock",
      "Log"
    ],
    "name": "actions",
    "value": "",
    "tooltip": "The action that was enforced.",
    "description": "Actions that were enforced on the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. You can choose from the following options: Block, Simulation Block, or Log."
  },
  {
    "title": "Rule",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "text",
    "name": "rule",
    "value": "",
    "tooltip": "The short rule name of the rule that triggered the events.",
    "placeholder": "e.g. sample_rule",
    "description": "Short rule name of the rule that triggered the events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR."
  },
  {
    "title": "Seen",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "select",
    "options": [
      "True",
      "False"
    ],
    "name": "seen",
    "value": "",
    "tooltip": "True/False parameter indicating whether events were read/unread.",
    "description": "True/False parameter indicating whether events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR were read/unread by the user operating the API."
  },
  {
    "title": "Handled",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "select",
    "options": [
      "True",
      "False"
    ],
    "name": "handled",
    "value": "",
    "tooltip": "True/False parameter indicating whether events were handled/unhandled.",
    "description": "True/False parameter indicating whether events that you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR were handled/unhandled."
  },
  {
    "title": "Archived",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "checkbox",
    "name": "archived",
    "value": false,
    "tooltip": "Enable to include only archived events.",
    "description": "True/False parameter indicating whether to include only archived events while retrieving events from Fortinet FortiEDR. By default, this is set as false."
  },
  {
    "title": "Organization",
    "required": false,
    "visible": true,
    "editable": true,
    "type": "select",
    "options": [
      "Exact organization name",
      "All organizations"
    ],
    "onchange": {
      "Exact organization name": [
        {
          "title": "Organization Name",
          "required": false,
          "visible": true,
          "editable": true,
          "type": "text",
          "placeholder": "The org name that you specify here must match exactly.",
          "description": "Name of a specific organization whose associated events you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR.Note: The value that you specify in this parameter must match exactly with the organization name specified in Fortinet FortiEDR.",
          "name": "org_name"
        }
      ]
    },
    "name": "organization",
    "value": "",
    "description": "Name of the organization whose associated events you want to retrieve from Fortinet FortiEDR. The value that you specify for this parameter indicates how the operation applies to an organization(s). Some parts of the enSilo system have separate, non-shared data that is organization-specific. Other parts of the system have data that is shared by all organizations. The value that you specify for the organization parameter, determines the organization(s) to which this operation applies.If you choose Exact organization name, then you must specify the following parameter:"
  }
]

routes.name: Fetch Events from FortiEDR -> Set Result
Get Macro Value -> Set Time Configuration
Set Organization -> Fetch Events from FortiEDR

workflows.name: Get IPSet List
workflows.description: Retrieve the list of IP set based on the IP.

workflows.name: FortiEDR > Ingest
workflows.description: This playbook  fetches events from FortiEDR and create records in FortiSOAR.

resource.name: {{vars.item.eventId}} - {{vars.item["collectors"][0]["device"]}}
resource.computerName: {% set device_list = []%}{% for collector in vars.item["collectors"]%}{%set dummy = device_list.append(collector.device)%}{%endfor%}{{device_list | toJSON}}

routes.name: Create Asset -> Update Last Event Pull Time

workflows.name: Get Event by ID
workflows.description: Retrieves a specific event from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the event ID you have specified.

arguments.title: Fortinet FortiEDR: Get Event by ID

workflows.name: Retrieve File or Memory
workflows.description: Retrieves a file or memory related to a specific event from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the raw event ID and other input parameters you have specified and adds it as an attachment in CyOPsâ„¢.

arguments.title: Fortinet FortiEDR: Retrieve File or Memory

workflows.name: > FortiEDR > Controlled Asset Creation
workflows.description: This playbook will handle the asset creation in a controlled way. check for existing assets before new asset creation.

workflows.name: Search Filehash
workflows.description: Searches a file hash among the current events, threat hunting repository, and communicating applications that exist in the Fortinet FortiEDR system.

workflows.name: Create IPSet
workflows.description: Create the IP Set using given set of IP Addresses

workflows.name: Get Collector List
workflows.description: Retrieves the list of the collectors from Fortinet FortiEDR based on the device type, device name/ID, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: >> FortiEDR > Handle Macro
workflows.description: This playbook create FortiEDR macro if not exists.

routes.name: Get QRadar Macros -> Is Splunk Macro Exist
Is Splunk Macro Exist -> Fetch Macro Current Value
routes.label: Yes

routes.name: Fetch Macro Current Value -> No Operation
Is FortiEDR Macro Exist -> Create FortiEDR Macro
routes.label: No

workflows.name: Get Exception List
workflows.description: Retrieve the list of exception based on the filter.

workflows.name: Get Raw JSON Event Data
workflows.description: Retrieve the raw data of event based on the event ID.

arguments.title: Fortinet FortiEDR: Get Raw JSON Event Data

routes.name: Alerts -> Get Raw JSON Event Data

workflows.name: Get System Summary
workflows.description: Gets a summary of the environment

workflows.name: > FortiEDR > Create and Link Asset
workflows.description: Create asset (if it doesn't exist already), and link to specified email, alert or incident

routes.name: Do Records Exist -> Create New Asset
routes.label: Yes

routes.name: Start -> Check if indicator already exists
Retrieve Existing Records -> Do Records Exist

workflows.name: Update IPSet
workflows.description: Update the IP Set with member

workflows.name: Get Event Exceptions
workflows.description: Retrieve the list of exception based on the event ID.
